items.title: Vi seeks spectrum surrender to reduce Rs 6,091-crore bank guarantee burden
items.description: The company, formed by the 2018 merger of Vodafone India and Idea Cellular, stated that this is its only pending securitisation requirement from the March 2015 auction

items.title: Less than 1% of health claims in India are for mental health, report reveals
items.description: The finding was part of Marsh McLennan’s "RiseUP for a Better Tomorrow" Mental Health Report 2025

items.title: Control Print: Are all the concerns priced in?
items.description: The company’s focus is now on larger accounts as also the introduction of new products

items.title: SBFC Finance: How justified is the valuation of this stock?
items.description: The company’s focus is on easier access to credit across rural and semi urban India

items.title: Zerodha has no plans to go public, and does not require additional capital: Nithin Kamath
items.description: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath said that there are no plans to list on exchanges, as the capital market disclosure requirements will be ‘hard’ to follow, and with the business is already highly-regulated, they do not want to subject themselves to further oversight.

items.title: Does this mid-sized private bank offer good risk-reward potential?
items.description: Net advances increased to Rs 47,780 crore by December 2024, registering a 23% growth YoY

items.title: Bharti Airtel prepays additional spectrum dues worth nearly Rs 6,000 crore, redeems $1 billion in debt
items.description: Airtel said it has now prepaid Rs 25,981 crore of high-cost spectrum liabilities for FY25, and cumulatively prepaid liabilities of Rs 66,665 crore as on date.

items.title: Delhi HC restrains Natco Pharma from launching generic of Roche's rare disease drug
items.description: "Roche has filed an appeal against the Hon. Delhi High Court order and the matter is subjudice in the appeal court," Roche Pharma India spokesperson told Moneycontrol.

items.title: India’s power sector facing shortage of skilled workforce?
items.description: The government is actively looking to increase its skilled and professional manpower base to tackle dynamic fields such as cybersecurity and Artifical Intelligence (AI) as the country plans to increase its transmission grid network by 34 percent till 2030, according to senior officials in the Ministry of Power.

items.title: Room ACs could contribute 120 GW to India's peak power demand by 2030: UC Berkeley study
items.description: The report also calls for updating AC test procedures to better reflect India's humid climate, where comfort depends not just on cooling but on moisture removal.
